name: "Funny Farm" Facts Quiz | Funny Farm | 15 Questions

questions.text: Who was the actress that portrayed Elizabeth Farmer?
questions.explanation:
Madolyn Smith-Osborne.

	Madolyn Smith had her film debut in 1980 opposite John Travolta in "Urban Cowboy".  She married NHL hockey player Mark Osborne.

questions.text: What was the name of the moving company that moved the Farmers' to Red Bud?
questions.explanation:
Triboro Movers, Inc.

	The movers were lost for several hours before they found their way to Red Bud.  The first item they moved off of the truck was Andy's writing chair which they promptly threw into the pond.

questions.text: What was the name of the novel that Andy was writing for Hough, Nagle, and Brown?
options: How to Knock Over a Casino
he had not net come up with a name
questions.explanation:
The Big Heist.

	Andy says this name several times throughout the film and he is shown typing it for the title page of the novel.

questions.text: What was the name of the drunken mailman who always threw their mail out onto the road?
questions.explanation:
Crum Petree.

	Crum Petree was always "pretty well liquored up and pissed off" because their house was five miles off of his normal route.  Kevin Conway's cackle is the only thing heard of him in this film except for one small scene to impress the prosecptive buyers.  He can also be seen in "Slaughterhouse-Five" (1972) and "Thirteen Days" (2000).

questions.text: What does Andy catch in the pond when he goes fishing?
questions.explanation:
snake.

	A funny scene where the snake comes flying out of the pond and wraps around Chevy Chase's character.  He unsuccessfully tries to catch it but it goes into the open door of his house causing his wife to scream loudly.

questions.text: What was the last name of the couple that the Farmers' bought the house from?
questions.explanation:
Musselman.

	Claude and Eula Musselman were the occupants name.  It was discovered after the Farmers' had moved into the house that Claude was buried in the garden.

questions.text: What type of shop did Mrs. Ethel Dingus run?
questions.explanation:
antique shop.

	Alice Drummond portrayed Mrs. Dingus.

questions.text: What was the name of the getaway that Andy took Elizabeth to for their wedding anniversary?
questions.explanation:
Sid's Hideaway Bungalows.

	This is where Elizabeth read Andy's novel and broke into tears because she hated it.

questions.text: What kind of book did Elizabeth write behind Andy's back AND what was the name of the squirrel in the book?
questions.explanation:
children's book; Andy.

	She wrote the book out long hand and sent it to a publisher from one of Andy's magazines.  Andy the squirrel gets run over by a truck at the end of the first book.

questions.text: What was the name of the cafe that the Farmers' took the prospective house buyers to for dinner in Red Bud?
questions.explanation:
Ivy's.

	This is the cafe where Andy became the new record holder for eating the most lamb fries at one time.

questions.text: What were the names of the prospective house buyers?
questions.explanation:
Bud and Betsy Culbertson.

	These roles were played by Jack Gilpin and Caris Corfman.

questions.text: This film is actually based on a novel by Jay Cronley.
questions.explanation:
True.

	He also wrote the novels "Hold-Up" (1985) and "Quick Change" (1990)which were both turned into films.

questions.text: George Roy Hill directed this film.  Which of the following movies did he also direct?
questions.explanation:
All of the these.

	He was a very successful director who died on December 27, 2002 of complications due to Parkinson's Disease.  He had a very successful film directing career.  "Funny Farm" was the last major studio film that he directed in his career.

questions.text: Bill Fagerbakke who portrayed Lon Criterion played in which long running successful television sitcom?
questions.explanation:
Coach.

	He played Michael "Dauber" Dybinski.  He is also a successful voice actor in cartoons  whose credits include "Gargoyles"; "Hercules"; and "SpongeBob SquarePants".

questions.text: Finally a question regarding Chevy Chase.  What successful series of films did Chevy star in during the 1980s and 1990s?
questions.explanation:
"Vacation" movies.

	Chevy starred as the unforgettable character Clark W. Griswold in "Vacation" (1983); "European Vacation" (1985); "Christmas Vacation" (1989); and "Vegas Vacation" (1997).
